text: The men's single sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. A top-nine finish ensured qualification for the Tokyo Olympics. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 25 August 2019 || 16:57 || Heats |- | Monday 26 August 2019 || 15:40 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Wednesday 28 August 2019 || 13:17 || Quarterfinals AD |- | 16:04 || Quarterfinals EH |- | rowspan=3|Thursday 29 August 2019 || 15:20 || Semifinals G/H |- | 15:40 || Semifinals E/F |- | 16:10 || Semifinals C/D |- | Friday 30 August 2019 || 12:20 || Semifinals A/B |- | rowspan=4|Saturday 31 August 2019 || 09:18 || Final H |- | 09:23 || Final G |- | 09:28 || Final F |- | 09:33 || Final E |- | rowspan=4|Sunday 1 September 2019 || 10:30 || Final D |- | 11:06 || Final C |- | 12:30 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 14:46 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== The two fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the AD quarterfinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Stefanos Douskos |
